trans-unit.source: Scenario - Send a Company-Confidential Email
trans-unit.target: Scenario - Send a Company-Confidential Email

trans-unit.source: This scenario and supporting user documentation uses Azure Rights Management so that any user in the organization can safely send email communications that cannot be read outside the organization.
trans-unit.target: This scenario and supporting user documentation uses Azure Rights Management so that any user in the organization can safely send email communications that cannot be read outside the organization.

trans-unit.source: For example, if somebody forwards the email message to somebody in another organization or to a personal email account.
trans-unit.target: For example, if somebody forwards the email message to somebody in another organization or to a personal email account.

trans-unit.source: The emails and any attachments will be protected by Azure Rights Management and a template that users select from the email client.
trans-unit.target: The emails and any attachments will be protected by Azure Rights Management and a template that users select from the email client.

trans-unit.source: The simplest way to enable this scenario is to use one of the built-in, default templates that automatically restrict access to all users in your organization.
trans-unit.target: The simplest way to enable this scenario is to use one of the built-in, default templates that automatically restrict access to all users in your organization.

trans-unit.source: But if required, you can make this more restrictive by creating a custom template that for example, restricts access to a subset of users, or has other restrictions such as read-only or an expiration date, or disables the Forward button in the email client.
trans-unit.target: But if required, you can make this more restrictive by creating a custom template that for example, restricts access to a subset of users, or has other restrictions such as read-only or an expiration date, or disables the Forward button in the email client.

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, although you can remove the Forward right from a custom template that you configure, and this will disable the Forward button in the email client, this configuration doesn't prevent users from sharing the email with another authorized user.
trans-unit.target: In this scenario, although you can remove the Forward right from a custom template that you configure, and this will disable the Forward button in the email client, this configuration doesn't prevent users from sharing the email with another authorized user.

trans-unit.source: The recipient could save the email (and any attachments) and then share the information by using other sharing mechanisms.
trans-unit.target: The recipient could save the email (and any attachments) and then share the information by using other sharing mechanisms.

trans-unit.source: For example, Bob sends an email to Alice using a custom template that applies the Save File and Edit Content custom rights to the Marketing group, and does not include the Forward right.
trans-unit.target: For example, Bob sends an email to Alice using a custom template that applies the Save File and Edit Content custom rights to the Marketing group, and does not include the Forward right.

trans-unit.source: Even though Alice cannot forward the email to others, she can save the email message and any attachments to a USB drive or file server share, which any member of the Marketing group can then read and edit if they can access these files.
trans-unit.target: Even though Alice cannot forward the email to others, she can save the email message and any attachments to a USB drive or file server share, which any member of the Marketing group can then read and edit if they can access these files.

trans-unit.source: Users who are not in the Marketing group will not be able to open the content.
trans-unit.target: Users who are not in the Marketing group will not be able to open the content.

trans-unit.source: The instructions are suitable for the following set of circumstances:
trans-unit.target: The instructions are suitable for the following set of circumstances:

trans-unit.source: Any user within the organization wants to share information with others inside the organization, but that information should not be shared outside the organization.
trans-unit.target: Any user within the organization wants to share information with others inside the organization, but that information should not be shared outside the organization.

trans-unit.source: The information to be shared can be within the email message or attachment.
trans-unit.target: The information to be shared can be within the email message or attachment.

trans-unit.source: Users must manually select the template from within their email client.
trans-unit.target: Users must manually select the template from within their email client.

trans-unit.source: Deployment Instructions
trans-unit.target: Deployment Instructions

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the following requirements are in place before going on to the user documentation.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the following requirements are in place before going on to the user documentation.

trans-unit.source: Requirements for this Scenario
trans-unit.target: Requirements for this Scenario

trans-unit.source: For the instructions for this scenario to work, the following must be in place:
trans-unit.target: For the instructions for this scenario to work, the following must be in place:

trans-unit.source: Check
trans-unit.target: Check

trans-unit.source: Requirement
trans-unit.target: Requirement

trans-unit.source: If you need more information
trans-unit.target: If you need more information

trans-unit.source: You have prepared accounts and groups for Office 365 or Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: You have prepared accounts and groups for Office 365 or Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Preparing for Azure Rights Management</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Preparing for Azure Rights Management</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Your Azure Rights Management tenant key is managed by Microsoft; you are not using BYOK
trans-unit.target: Your Azure Rights Management tenant key is managed by Microsoft; you are not using BYOK

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Planning and Implementing Your Azure Rights Management Tenant Key</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Planning and Implementing Your Azure Rights Management Tenant Key</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Azure Rights Management is activated
trans-unit.target: Azure Rights Management is activated

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Activating Azure Rights Management</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Activating Azure Rights Management</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: One of the following:<html></html><html></html>Exchange Online is enabled for Azure Rights Management<html></html><html></html>The RMS connector is installed and configured for Exchange on-premises
trans-unit.target: One of the following:<html></html><html></html>Exchange Online is enabled for Azure Rights Management<html></html><html></html>The RMS connector is installed and configured for Exchange on-premises

trans-unit.source: For Exchange Online: Expand the <link><linkText>Exchange Online: IRM Configuration</linkText><title></title></link> section in <link><linkText>Configuring Applications for Azure Rights Management</linkText><title></title></link>.<html></html><html></html>For Exchange on-premises: <link><linkText>Deploying the Azure Rights Management Connector</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: For Exchange Online: Expand the <link><linkText>Exchange Online: IRM Configuration</linkText><title></title></link> section in <link><linkText>Configuring Applications for Azure Rights Management</linkText><title></title></link>.<html></html><html></html>For Exchange on-premises: <link><linkText>Deploying the Azure Rights Management Connector</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: You have not archived the default Azure Rights Management template - Confidential.
trans-unit.target: You have not archived the default Azure Rights Management template - Confidential.

trans-unit.source: Or, you have configured a custom template for this purpose because you need more restrictive settings or only a subset of users in the organization should be able to read the protected emails.
trans-unit.target: Or, you have configured a custom template for this purpose because you need more restrictive settings or only a subset of users in the organization should be able to read the protected emails.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Configuring Custom Templates for Azure Rights Management</linkText><title></title></link><html></html><html></html>Tip: If you need more restrictive usage policy settings but for all users in the organization, copy and then edit one of the default templates, rather than create a template from scratch.<html></html><html></html>Updated templates do not refresh immediately for the email clients in this scenario.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Configuring Custom Templates for Azure Rights Management</linkText><title></title></link><html></html><html></html>Tip: If you need more restrictive usage policy settings but for all users in the organization, copy and then edit one of the default templates, rather than create a template from scratch.<html></html><html></html>Updated templates do not refresh immediately for the email clients in this scenario.

trans-unit.source: Check the <link><linkText>Refreshing templates for users</linkText><title></title></link> section in the configuring templates article for information.
trans-unit.target: Check the <link><linkText>Refreshing templates for users</linkText><title></title></link> section in the configuring templates article for information.

trans-unit.source: Users that send the protected email have Outlook 2013 or Outlook 2016, or Outlook Web Access.<html></html><html></html>Users that receive the email have an email client that supports Azure Rights Management.
trans-unit.target: Users that send the protected email have Outlook 2013 or Outlook 2016, or Outlook Web Access.<html></html><html></html>Users that receive the email have an email client that supports Azure Rights Management.

trans-unit.source: You can use Outlook 2010, but you must install the Rights Management sharing application for Windows and adjust the user instructions accordingly.For a list of email clients that support Azure Rights Management, see the Email column in the Client devices capability table, from Requirements for Azure Rights Management
trans-unit.target: You can use Outlook 2010, but you must install the Rights Management sharing application for Windows and adjust the user instructions accordingly.For a list of email clients that support Azure Rights Management, see the Email column in the Client devices capability table, from Requirements for Azure Rights Management

trans-unit.source: User Documentation Instructions
trans-unit.target: User Documentation Instructions

trans-unit.source: Using the following template, copy and paste the user instructions into a communication for your end users, and make these modifications to reflect your environment:
trans-unit.target: Using the following template, copy and paste the user instructions into a communication for your end users, and make these modifications to reflect your environment:

trans-unit.source: Replace all instances of with the name of your organization.
trans-unit.target: Replace all instances of with the name of your organization.

trans-unit.source: Replace all instances of with the name of your default or custom template.
trans-unit.target: Replace all instances of with the name of your default or custom template.

trans-unit.source: Replace the screenshots so that they show your organization template names.
trans-unit.target: Replace the screenshots so that they show your organization template names.

trans-unit.source: Replace with instructions for how your users can contact the help desk, such as a website link, email address, or telephone number.
trans-unit.target: Replace with instructions for how your users can contact the help desk, such as a website link, email address, or telephone number.

trans-unit.source: Additional modifications you might want to make:
trans-unit.target: Additional modifications you might want to make:

trans-unit.source: If it is practical to limit instructions to one email client only, consider doing this for simplicity and delete the other set of instructions.
trans-unit.target: If it is practical to limit instructions to one email client only, consider doing this for simplicity and delete the other set of instructions.

trans-unit.source: If you use a custom template rather than the suggested default template, revise the wording in accordingly:
trans-unit.target: If you use a custom template rather than the suggested default template, revise the wording in accordingly:

trans-unit.source: Make the title more specific.
trans-unit.target: Make the title more specific.

trans-unit.source: Specify the users or groups to select in step 1.
trans-unit.target: Specify the users or groups to select in step 1.

trans-unit.source: Specify the name of the custom template in step 2.
trans-unit.target: Specify the name of the custom template in step 2.

trans-unit.source: Modify the final paragraph to explain the restrictions the recipients will have.
trans-unit.target: Modify the final paragraph to explain the restrictions the recipients will have.

trans-unit.source: Make any other modifications that you want to this set of instructions, and then send it to these users.
trans-unit.target: Make any other modifications that you want to this set of instructions, and then send it to these users.

trans-unit.source: Because some clients do not support Rights Management, you might need to provide guidance and recommendations for the recipients of these protected email messages.
trans-unit.target: Because some clients do not support Rights Management, you might need to provide guidance and recommendations for the recipients of these protected email messages.

trans-unit.source: This information will be based on which devices and email applications are in use in your organization and any preferences that you have.
trans-unit.target: This information will be based on which devices and email applications are in use in your organization and any preferences that you have.

trans-unit.source: For example, recommend that iOS users read protected emails with Outlook for iPad and iPhone rather than the native iOS mail client.
trans-unit.target: For example, recommend that iOS users read protected emails with Outlook for iPad and iPhone rather than the native iOS mail client.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the email clients, see the Email column in the Client devices capability table, from Requirements for Azure Rights Management.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the email clients, see the Email column in the Client devices capability table, from Requirements for Azure Rights Management.

trans-unit.source: The example documentation shows how these instructions might look for users, after your customizations.
trans-unit.target: The example documentation shows how these instructions might look for users, after your customizations.

trans-unit.source: How to send emails that contain company-confidential information using Outlook
trans-unit.target: How to send emails that contain company-confidential information using Outlook

trans-unit.source: Within Outlook, create a new mail message, add any attachments that you want to include, and then select users or groups from .
trans-unit.target: Within Outlook, create a new mail message, add any attachments that you want to include, and then select users or groups from .

trans-unit.source: From the OPTIONS tab, click Permission, and then select :
trans-unit.target: From the OPTIONS tab, click Permission, and then select :

trans-unit.source: Send the message.
trans-unit.target: Send the message.

trans-unit.source: How to send emails that contain company-confidential information using Outlook Web App
trans-unit.target: How to send emails that contain company-confidential information using Outlook Web App

trans-unit.source: Within the Outlook Web App, create a new mail message, add any attachments that you want to include, and then select users or groups from the address book.
trans-unit.target: Within the Outlook Web App, create a new mail message, add any attachments that you want to include, and then select users or groups from the address book.

trans-unit.source: Click …, click Set permissions, and then select :
trans-unit.target: Click …, click Set permissions, and then select :

trans-unit.source: Send the message.
trans-unit.target: Send the message.

trans-unit.source: When somebody on the To, Cc, or Bcc line receives this email, they might be asked to authenticate before they can read the message, to verify that they are a user from .
trans-unit.target: When somebody on the To, Cc, or Bcc line receives this email, they might be asked to authenticate before they can read the message, to verify that they are a user from .

trans-unit.source: Other times, users are not prompted because they are already authenticated.
trans-unit.target: Other times, users are not prompted because they are already authenticated.

trans-unit.source: People that you send your email to will be able to forward it to other people, but only users from will be able to read it.
trans-unit.target: People that you send your email to will be able to forward it to other people, but only users from will be able to read it.

trans-unit.source: If you attach an Office document, it will have the same protection, even if that attachment is saved with a different name, to another location.
trans-unit.target: If you attach an Office document, it will have the same protection, even if that attachment is saved with a different name, to another location.

trans-unit.source: However, successfully authenticated users can copy and paste from the email or attachment, or print from it.
trans-unit.target: However, successfully authenticated users can copy and paste from the email or attachment, or print from it.

trans-unit.source: If you need more restrictive protection that prevents actions such as these, contact the help desk.
trans-unit.target: If you need more restrictive protection that prevents actions such as these, contact the help desk.

trans-unit.source: Need help?
trans-unit.target: Need help?

trans-unit.source: Contact the help desk:
trans-unit.target: Contact the help desk:

trans-unit.target: Example Customized User Documentation

trans-unit.source: How to send emails that contain company-confidential information using Outlook
trans-unit.target: How to send emails that contain company-confidential information using Outlook

trans-unit.source: Within Outlook, create a new mail message, add any attachments that you want to include, and then select VanArsdel users or groups from the address book.
trans-unit.target: Within Outlook, create a new mail message, add any attachments that you want to include, and then select VanArsdel users or groups from the address book.

trans-unit.source: From the OPTIONS tab, click Permission, and then select VanArsdel, Ltd - Confidential:
trans-unit.target: From the OPTIONS tab, click Permission, and then select VanArsdel, Ltd - Confidential:

trans-unit.source: Send the message.
trans-unit.target: Send the message.

trans-unit.source: How to send emails that contain company-confidential information using Outlook Web App
trans-unit.target: How to send emails that contain company-confidential information using Outlook Web App

trans-unit.source: Within the Outlook Web App, create a new mail message, add any attachments that you want to include, and then select VanArsdel users or groups from the address book.
trans-unit.target: Within the Outlook Web App, create a new mail message, add any attachments that you want to include, and then select VanArsdel users or groups from the address book.

trans-unit.source: Click …, click Set permissions, and then select VanArsdel, Ltd - Confidential:
trans-unit.target: Click …, click Set permissions, and then select VanArsdel, Ltd - Confidential:

trans-unit.source: Send the message.
trans-unit.target: Send the message.

trans-unit.source: When somebody on the To, Cc, or Bcc line receives this email, they might be asked to authenticate before they can read the message, to verify that they are a user from VanArsdel, Ltd.
trans-unit.target: When somebody on the To, Cc, or Bcc line receives this email, they might be asked to authenticate before they can read the message, to verify that they are a user from VanArsdel, Ltd.

trans-unit.source: Other times, users are not prompted because they are already authenticated.
trans-unit.target: Other times, users are not prompted because they are already authenticated.

trans-unit.source: People that you send your email to will be able to forward it to other people, but only users from VanArsdel will be able to read it.
trans-unit.target: People that you send your email to will be able to forward it to other people, but only users from VanArsdel will be able to read it.

trans-unit.source: If you attach an Office document, it will have the same protection, even if that attachment is saved with a different name, to another location.
trans-unit.target: If you attach an Office document, it will have the same protection, even if that attachment is saved with a different name, to another location.

trans-unit.source: However, successfully authenticated users can copy and paste from the email or attachment, or print from it.
trans-unit.target: However, successfully authenticated users can copy and paste from the email or attachment, or print from it.

trans-unit.source: If you need more restrictive protection that prevents actions such as these, contact the help desk.
trans-unit.target: If you need more restrictive protection that prevents actions such as these, contact the help desk.
